task: Using the kidney Xenium dataset with per-cell spatial centroids (x, y), subset the AnnData to cells where adata.obs['CN'] equals 'CN5: Collecting Duct Niche'. Then cluster the cells into 3 subclusters and assign labels using the exact vocabulary: PC, ICA, ICB. Use the following marker genes to guide labeling (higher expression in the indicated subtype vs others): PC: Aqp2; ICA: Atp6v1b1, Slc4a1; ICB: Slc26a4. Then report the distribution of these CD subtypes as percentages of total CD cells. Percentages should sum to ~100%. Include any missing subtypes with 0%. Vocabulary: PC, ICA, ICB. Return EXACTLY: <EVAL_ANSWER>{"total_cells": <integer total CD cells>, "cell_type_distribution": {"PC": <percentage>, "ICA": <percentage>, "ICB": <percentage>}}</EVAL_ANSWER>

cell_type_percentages.description: Each subtype percentage must be within Â±5 percentage points of ground truth.
